PageTitle: ptp clock-source bits1 (virtual access ap-id view)
FuncDef:
The ptp clock-source bits1  command sets the delay corrections for time signals that a BITS interface sends and receives.
The undo ptp clock-source bits1  command restores the default delay corrections for time signals that a BITS interface sends and receives.
The default delay correction is 0 ns.
CLIs: ptp clock-source bits1 { receive-delay <receive-delay-value> | send-delay <send-delay-value> } [ slot <slotid> ]
undo ptp clock-source bits1 { receive-delay | send-delay } [ slot <slotid> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Sets the delay correction for time signals that a BITS interface receives.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 2000000.

Sets the delay correction for time signals that a BITS interface sends.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 10000.

Specifies the slot ID of the main control board.
The value is a string of 1 to 16 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The ptp clock-source receive-delay send-delay command helps a BITS interface correct time signals that the BITS interface exchanges with a clock source or a slave clock based on the specified link delay time.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
